contextDescription: Introduction to test-driven development in Python, focusing on doctest and unittest frameworks, writing test cases, and validating code through comprehensive testing
learningObjectives: Understand why Python programming is awesome
Learn what an interactive test is and why tests are important
Master writing docstrings to create tests
Write documentation for modules and functions
Create basic option flags to create tests
Find edge cases and implement test cases for them
Understand the concept of Test-Driven Development
Learn to write tests before implementing functions
Use both doctest and unittest frameworks
Master the difference between using assertion and raising exceptions
Validate code against test cases systematically
